Database¶

This section details the methods and classes that manipulate the database.

Database Service¶

class database.database_service.DatabaseService¶

An api for interacting with sqlalchemy. When creating the object, it associates this instance to a sqlalchemy session. When the object is deleted by the garbage collector the session is terminated, collecting an exception if this happens.

__init__()¶
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

Database Crud¶

class database.database_service.DataBaseCrud¶

Basic database operations (CRUD). The methods are of the class, because interaction with the sqlalchemy session is done from a class that represents a table in the database. a table in the database, thus abstracting a layer of complexity for the developer.

__parse_table(no_fk: bool = True, no_none: bool = True, no_id: bool = True) → dict¶

Helper method for formatting an advent table from the database.

Parameters

  • no_fk – If the dictionary contains foreign key columns should be added to the final formatting.

  • no_none (bool, optional) – Whether null columns should be added to the final formatting.

  • no_id (bool, optional) – Whether or not columns of type primary key should be added to to the final formatting.

__repr__()¶

Return repr(self).

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

delete(connection: database.database_service.DatabaseService)¶

Deletes a record in the database.

Parameters

connection – Connection to the database, of type database.database_service.DatabaseServicer.

classmethod find_all(connection: database.database_service.DatabaseService, page: int = 0, quantity: int = 100, is_active: database.database_service.str_or_bool = True) → Generator¶

Returns all the records in the database from the filter entered. Paging the result and returning a generator.

Parameters

  • connection – Connection to the database, of type database.database_service.DatabaseServicer.

  • page (int) – Offset of the query.

  • quantity (int) – Number of records per page

  • is_active (bool, optional) – If only active records and records from tables that have an is_active’ column.

Returns

Result of the query.

Return type

generator

insert(connection: database.database_service.DatabaseService)¶

Adds a record to the database.

Parameters

connection – Connection to the database, of type database.database_service.DatabaseServicer.

Returns

Self

classmethod list_one(connection: database.database_service.DatabaseService, filter: Optional[tuple] = None, order_by: Optional[tuple] = None)¶

Finds and returns the first record in the database from the filter entered.

Parameters

  • connection – Connection to the database, of type database.database_service.DatabaseServicer.

  • filter (tuple) – Filter to apply on query.

  • order_by (tuple) – Whether to apply an order_by of type (column, sort).

Returns

Record found.

Return type

sqlalchemy.query

classmethod search(connection: database.database_service.DatabaseService, filter: Optional[tuple] = None, after: int = 0, limit: int = 100, is_active: database.database_service.str_or_bool = True, order_by: Optional[tuple] = None) → Generator¶

Searches for all records from the filter entered. Paginating the result and returning a generator.

Parameters

  • connection – Connection to the database, of type database.database_service.DatabaseServicer.

  • filter (tuple) – Filter to be applied to the query, of type (Table.column == column).

  • after (int) – Number of results that should be skipped in the query.

  • limit (int) – Limit of results per page

  • is_active (bool, optional) – If only active records and records from tables that have an is_active’ column.

  • order_by (tuple) – Whether an order_by of type (column, sort).

Returns

Result of the query.

Return type

generator

to_dict(no_fk: bool = True, no_none: bool = True, no_id: bool = True)¶

Returns a dictionary from an instance of the class database.database_service.DatabaseCrud

Parameters

  • no_fk (bool, optional) – Whether or not data of type foreign key should be added to the dictionary.

  • no_none (bool, optional) – Whether or not null columns should be added to the dictionary.

  • no_id (bool, optional) – Whether or not primary key data should be added to the dictionary. to the dictionary.

classmethod update(connection: database.database_service.DatabaseService, filter: tuple, data: dict) → list¶

Updates a database record.

Parameters

  • connection – Connection to the database, of type database.database_service.DatabaseServicer.

  • filter (tuple) – Filter to be applied to the query, of type (Table.column == column)

  • data (dict) – Column and values to be updated of type column: value.

Raises

UpdateTableException – If any of the columns in the data parameter parameter does not exist in the table.

Returns

List of all records updated from the filter entered.

Return type

list
